agents.impl.sockets

Class SocketServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • agents.MetaAgent
      • agents.impl.sockets.SocketAgent
        • agents.impl.sockets.SocketServer

  • public class SocketServer
extends SocketAgent
    A server-sided socket implementation that allows for transmitting Messages across a network. The SocketServer is used as a relay in this case for directing messages across the network to many different clients. When a client connects to this SocketServer an instance of SocketHandler is spawned and ran to handle the inbound/outbound connections and freeing up the server thread to accept more connections if needed.

    • Method Detail

      • threadRun

        protected void threadRun()
        Description copied from class: MetaAgent
        Runs the logic that would usually happen within the running of the anonymous backing thread. This is to allow for overriding within child classes should the need arise for changing the running operation of the agent.
        Overrides:
        threadRun in class MetaAgent

      • execute

        protected void execute(Message message)
        Prevents SocketServers from executing messages.
        Specified by:
        execute in class MetaAgent
        Parameters:
        message - The message to execute (does nothing).

      • getSocket

        protected java.net.ServerSocket getSocket()
        Gets the underlying ServerSocket from this server object.
        Returns:
        The underlying ServerSocket

      • getHandler

        protected final SocketHandler getHandler(java.lang.String clientName)
        Returns a SocketHandler based off of the clientName specified. This checks the connected SocketConnections for a client name that matches the one given and returns the handler.
        Parameters:
        clientName - The client name to search for.
        Returns:
        A valid handler which is for the user clientName or null if one does not exist.

      • identify

        protected final void identify(SocketConnection sc,
                              java.lang.String clientName)
        Registers the identity of a given SocketConnection, overwriting its SocketConnection.clientName with the one given and saving it. Ideally this is ran only once; future checks will be put in place to ensure the single-use of this method for assigning identities to a connection.
        Parameters:
        sc - The SocketConnection to change the client name of.
        clientName - The new client's name to register as the socket's identity.
